Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2011 06:01PM lilredpony wrote: I am very greatful for this website, I am also looking forward to eventually helping women like me who come into this so very scared and to let them know they are not alone like I thought I was!  Still scared, but I know Im not alone so I will use my positive attitude to the max and continue to live my life as close to normal as possible, and prayer. Pray that they do find a cure for us all.
Posts.Title: Im a newby and scared lilredpony DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2011 10:14AM lilredpony wrote: thank you ever ever Ever so much, its needed today, i'm alone and bored and you know, you just start thinking.........

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2011 10:16AM lilredpony wrote: i'll take anything! Grandbabies girls/boys! YAAAAAYYY!
Posts.Title: Im a newby and scared lilredpony DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2011 10:57AM lilredpony wrote: Wholly Hannah! Praise God, I am so amazed that there is someone like you.  I'm sorry, I'm bawling my eyes out as I type right now because I am so scared right now and in pain because I took the Nulasta shot yesterday and feel pretty yucky.  I have a bone met on my rib and lower back.  Im completely taken aback on how many of you have similar to me.  It does give me hope.  I will pray for you all  - THANK YOU for your stories, it means so much right now and I hope to be a survivor someday for my kids and grandkids and husband
Posts.Title: Im a newby and scared lilredpony DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2011 10:09AM lilredpony wrote: im still scared and need a little "boost" every now and then I guess, my doctor now has me on Erubulin and I'm praying it will work
Posts.Title: Im a newby and scared lilredpony DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2011 10:11AM lilredpony wrote: i'm praying my new treatment Erubulin works, but this neuropathy in my fingers is driving me bonkers! typing is fun.  another thing, i feel so ugly in front of my husband, anything to help with that? he doesnt mind, or says he doesnt care, but i do
Posts.Title: Im a newby and scared lilredpony DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: lilredpony wrote: to say the least, i was diagnosed w/stage 4. Just saying that scares the ever living junk outta me!  I know there are survivors out there, I actually had the priviledge of meeting a few at a survivor function, so I know it can be done, but I cannot help but still be petrified. I went through 6 rounds of Adriomycin (sp?)  that did not work, now I'm on Taxol, the first round I took started working, but stopped working about a week before my 2nd round was supposed to take place, my bc got worse yet and now I'm on a higher dose of Taxol and pray day and night that this is right.  You better believe I am on pain killers, which last year I would bareley even take a tylenol for a little headache.  Is there any words of wisdom here for me?  I know I cannot be done yet here on earth, my daughter is talking grandchildren soon!  She says she needs me and I want so very much to be here for her, so I'm going to fight as hard as I can! Dx 6/28/2011, IBC, Stage IV, mets, ER-/PR- Log in to post a reply
